intro: Goldfussia oligocephala var. treutleri, commonly known as the narrow-headed goldfussia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
